summary: Over the six-hour window wind averaged 14.24 m/s (σ 1.46) with a peak to 27.4 m/s; power stayed high and tightly clustered around 0.9607 (σ 0.046) with a small positive residual bias (~0.10). Rotor speed was very stable (rpm σ 0.0229) while generator speed showed notably higher variability (σ 0.7666); pitch averaged ~8° and yaw misalignment ~2.2°, and mean component temperature was elevated at ~67.6°C, indicating steady production under strong winds with occasional high gusts and modest generator‑side variability.
